meta.description: Family members, common foods, everyday objects, and telling time in Japanese.

module.name: Daily Life
module.description: Learn vocabulary for family, food, everyday objects, and time expressions.

lessons.title: Family and Daily Words
lessons.description: Learn essential vocabulary for family members, common foods, and household items.

flashcards.back: 牛乳 (ぎゅうにゅう / Gyuunyuu)

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'my mother' in Japanese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '母' (haha) for your own mother. 'お母さん' for someone else's or polite.

quiz_questions.question: What does '兄' (ani) mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: '兄' means older brother. '弟' (otōto) is younger brother.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'water' in Japanese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '水' (mizu) means water.

quiz_questions.question: What is 'パン' in English?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'パン' (pan) means bread (from Portuguese 'pão').

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'house/home' in Japanese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '家' (ie) means house/home.

lessons.title: Possession and Existence
lessons.description: Learn possessive expressions and います/あります for existence.

flashcards.back: 私の (わたしの / Watashi no)

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'my mother' in Japanese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '私の母' - possessor + の + possessed.

quiz_questions.question: '兄弟がいます' means:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'います' indicates existence of living things = 'I have siblings'.

quiz_questions.question: Which verb is used for 'there is a book'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'あります' for inanimate objects. 本があります = There is a book.

quiz_questions.question: Complete: '猫__います' (There is a cat)
quiz_questions.explanation: '猫がいます' - が marks the subject with います/あります.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'I have two brothers'?
options: 私は兄弟が二人います
quiz_questions.explanation: '私は兄弟が二人います' - topic + subject + counter + います.

quiz_questions.question: What is the counter for people?
quiz_questions.explanation: '人' (nin/ri) is the counter for people.

quiz_questions.question: 'これは私の家です' means:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'これ' (this) + は + 私の家 (my house) + です (is).

quiz_questions.question: Which particle shows possession?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'の' connects possessor and possessed: 私の本 (my book).

lessons.title: Family Conversations
lessons.description: Practice talking about your family and daily routines.

flashcards.back: 兄弟がいますか (Kyōdai ga imasu ka)
兄が二人います (Ani ga futari imasu)

quiz_questions.question: How do you ask 'Do you have siblings?' in Japanese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '兄弟がいますか' uses います for people.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'I live with my family'?
quiz_questions.explanation: '家族と住んでいます' - と = with, 住んでいます = am living.

quiz_questions.question: What does '何時ですか' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: '何時ですか' (Nanji desu ka) asks for the time.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'It's 3 o'clock'?
quiz_questions.explanation: '三時です' (Sanji desu) - 時 (ji) means o'clock.

quiz_questions.question: How do you respond to '兄弟は何人いますか'?
quiz_questions.explanation: '三人います' - answer with number + counter + います.

lessons.title: Reading About Daily Life
lessons.description: Read and understand texts about family and daily routines.

quiz_questions.question: Read: '私の家族は大きいです。兄が三人います。' How many older brothers?
quiz_questions.explanation: '三人' (sannin) means three people.

quiz_questions.question: Read: '朝ご飯を八時に食べます。' When does the person eat breakfast?
quiz_questions.explanation: '八時に' means at 8 o'clock.

quiz_questions.question: Read: '母は毎日料理をします。' What does the mother do?
quiz_questions.explanation: '料理をします' means 'does cooking' = cooks.

quiz_questions.question: Read: '私たちの家は小さいですが、きれいです。' The house is:
quiz_questions.explanation: '小さいですが、きれいです' = small but clean/pretty.

quiz_questions.question: Read: '日曜日に祖父母と昼ご飯を食べます。' When do they eat lunch with grandparents?
quiz_questions.explanation: '日曜日に' means on Sunday.

lessons.title: Days and Time Expressions
lessons.description: Learn to understand days of the week and time expressions.

flashcards.back: 月曜日 (げつようび / Getsuyōbi)
水曜日 (すいようび / Suiyōbi)
木曜日 (もくようび / Mokuyōbi)
金曜日 (きんようび / Kinyōbi)

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'GEH-tsoo-YOH-bee'?
quiz_questions.explanation: '月曜日' (Getsuyōbi - Monday) = 'moon day'.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'Saturday' in Japanese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '土曜日' (Doyōbi) = Saturday. '日曜日' = Sunday.

quiz_questions.question: Japanese days are named after:
quiz_questions.explanation: Days use 月火水木金土日 (moon, fire, water, wood, metal, earth, sun).

quiz_questions.question: What does '週末' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: '週末' (shūmatsu) = week + end = weekend.

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'SOO-ee-YOH-bee'?
quiz_questions.explanation: '水曜日' (Suiyōbi - Wednesday) = 'water day'.
